description: Transaction Charge Generic Items. These items are usually entered manually by users in charge entry, and are stored in the temporary accounts receivable (TAR) record. These items are customizable, so their use and meaning are defined by an administrator in the Professional Billing Profile. The backend items are not available to users for entry. Contact your administrator or Epic representative to find out their meaning. Note: TAR records in Chronicles are purged periodically depending on your system setting. Be aware that old data in this table might be lost if you truncate the table.

columns.name: TAR_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of a temporary transaction record.  This represents an individual charge session.

columns.name: DATE_ITEM_1_DT
columns.description: The value of charge generic date item 1 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry.

columns.name: DATE_ITEM_2_DT
columns.description: The value of charge generic date item 2 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry.

columns.name: CATEGORY_ITEM_1_C_NAME
columns.description:
The value of charge generic category item 1 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry. The category values are all custom values that can be viewed or entered by Administrators.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: CATEGORY_ITEM_2_C_NAME
columns.description:
The value of charge generic category item 2 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry. The category values are all custom values that can be viewed or entered by Administrators.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: CATEGORY_ITEM_3_C_NAME
columns.description:
The value of charge generic category item 3 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry. The category values are all custom values that can be viewed or entered by Administrators.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: STRING_ITEM_1
columns.description: The value of charge generic string item 1 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry.

columns.name: STRING_ITEM_2
columns.description: The value of charge generic string item 2 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry.

columns.name: STRING_ITEM_3
columns.description: The value of charge generic string item 3 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry.

columns.name: NUMERIC_ITEM_1
columns.description: The value of charge generic numeric item 1 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry.

columns.name: NUMERIC_ITEM_2
columns.description: The value of charge generic numeric item 2 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry.

columns.name: NETWORKED_ITEM_1
columns.description: The value of charge generic networked item 1 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry. This item is networked to records in a masterfile defined by an administrator in the professional billing profile.

columns.name: NETWORKED_ITEM_2
columns.description: The value of charge generic networked item 2 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered by users when the charge is posted in Charge Entry. This item is networked to records in a masterfile defined by an administrator in the professional billing profile.

columns.name: BACKEND_NUMERIC_1
columns.description: The value of charge generic backend numeric item 1 in the charge session (TAR) record. The information is entered programmatically. Contact your administrator or Epic representative to find out the meaning of the data.
